text: Hello!So, I got to wondering what y'all's definition of a successful life is. What do you guys want in life?1) What do you think the definition of success is, for you?2) If you could describe the perfect life, what would it look like. How much money would you have? What kind of job? Where would you live?Alright, go!

so sad. 3h no one?1) success in one thing is never enough for me. once something is achieved i immediately start on another goal.2) a perfect life would be to have enough money for everything in moderation be it food, accommodation, travel and daily expenses. having the opportunity to wear yourself out daily knowing that you'll be back to an environment of peaceful and joyful living, in short having a purpose in life. that's all
1) Bank account more than 2 million cash  2) Got passive income without working life, interest income and net worth more than 1 million USD, collect rental income and stay more than 3m property.
Interesting. What is your purpose in life, in your opinion? What goals did you set for yourself?
Why do you need so many millions? Do you have a plan on what to do with it? Why does the property need to be 3m?
first is to earn enough money so that buying power is no longer a concern. then to use it under no other influence but myself. goals.. too many to list. to summarize.. what most other people want?
I guess staying alive is the dream for now...no I am not having diseases, just trying not to mind others' business...

Success is a journey, not a destination.I started planning when I was 20 yo. Bought own house and car (2nd hand) when I was 23 yo. Yahoo .... got liao ! Then new goals for next 5 years. In every 5 yr plan was getting a better house. So my first house was in Cheras, then to Bangsar, TTDI (3 times there), now staying in fully paid up house in Mt. Kiara.Travelling was also high in my list. Visited 35 countries liao. Next year Finland in my to-do list.Then planing for children and education.Now retired liao ... must also planned for income (money) until 'expired'. Also just signed up burial plots. Don't want to kacau children ... just bought plots from Nirvana and gave children contract. If anything happened just call this number (in contract). Now usually go check out new places at MATA Fairs.
Because millionaire defined under Malaysiakini have net worth of 1m of USD and property price below 3m is too common in Malaysia (look at Penang & KL).
money and job does not get a long well
eat 3 meals, wake up to a happy SO, toys and a roof over my headall i need mate

According to a wealth report, only about 4% and 0.3% of adults in the kangkong land have over us$100k and us$1m net worth respectively. Well off and rich people are fewer than most thought.With elevated household debt, fewer people will attain high net worth.
when u have everything, u will realize u have nothing...
Contented is happiness.
Whatever that means!....  (pokemon abridged)

pssst - i tell you the truth , it's all an illusionone neighbour with huge home, very proud of his 'success'. All children overseas , the last I checked he is now 6 feet under. House now empty, wife also went oversea to spend the remaining life.another neighbour , huge home, many cars, shows off got many properties, but the last i heard got health problem , admitted to hospital.aging, sickness and death, is like a shadow that follows us , it never really goes away... success is only a name we give to illusion that our live won't end that way
ah, Great that was your very fortunate life to you
thats unfortunate life, cannot enjoy

They had all "enjoyed" their life, but age caught up. Having known this, do you still want to pursue the illusion of success?well, that aside, success can be seen as1. able to provide for family - parents and children2. able to know priorities in life - material and spiritual path3. guarding the morals, refrain in senses if need be4. making oneself useful to humanity, but not wasting oxygen5. do good, don't do bad
lol
The human mind spans d universe and beyond. Don't let it b shortsighted by mere money.
given today's standard of living/quality of life of a middle class or even working class in Malaysia, it is already perfect for my expectation.success means achieving one's goals
You mean age won't catch up if you don't enjoy your life?

This question has had me thinking for a while now. At this point in my life, I can comfortably say I am at a great place in life without wanting more. I am 30 and have everything I can ask for. A small business as a professional, a beautiful wife, active sporting and social life, a comfortable home (tho still on loan), cars paid off, heavily insured. The wife and I make quite abit of money and including our EPF, we save a good 60-70% of our income (we are not into the lavish lifestyle), accountable spiritually, almost successfully reigning in all my adolescent vices. Man thinking back the last 4 years was hellish to have build what I have today. Btw I was already financially independent since 18 so I'm already quite good with handling money. The one key to contentment is to reign in on your expectations, and not chase after lavish lifestyle that are meaningless and very often, done to please others. Everyday before I go to bed, I count my blessings and wonder what have I done to deserve what I have at such a young age. I'm still preparing for the day when it all goes to shit tho lol.Edit: I only live in a terrace far from the city, and have 2 regular Asian cars but I feel successful af
why you need 1M USDand 3M propertythese are the examples of 'asian' problem, where we are busy chasing 'numbers'which, at the end, translates to nothing...

1. Success is where I can do something I like and make a living with it.2. A perfect life is where A country where well behaved citizen,a good public transport,a good social welfare,an affordable living lifestyle, a citizen who knows what they want and need to live without heavily influent on luxury and fair competition on business. I personally hate money and personal finance. I live a Minimalist life, as long I have a decent extra cash for yearly travel to visit friends and learn their culture, and enough savings for future funeral. All should be fine, at the end of the way what a person left is just a memories and I wish to left a positive side instead of full of negative like what we have now with life. Career wise, something I love, good at and got respect and know the value how much they should pay. Is Malaysia a great place to stay? Maybe only in East Malaysia. Peninsular/Malaya is just a temporary for me. But if you talk about my personal dream, I used to live in Melbourne, Europe and Tokyo. I will choose Tokyo because everything is decent there and I prefer the lifestyle as Independent Career. But not good if you live for a company forever.
What else you can chase when you are breathing ? Most of us still need to work 9 to 6pm to pay off bills.

Ok so everyone talks about "goals". But what are those goals?So far it's "having enough to live comfortably", more or less.But what about beyond that? What are your goals beyond having money or property or family?
Early retirement with great passive income.Travel with my love and give full attention to my family.I also want to give my mom a great treatment for her diseases.
more interested in how u achieve or how u want to achieve rather then stating goals LOL in the end dunoe can achieve or not
